IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Informed and inspired through the mission of the Church, Catholic Charities of South Carolina promotes dignity, ministers to the spiritual and physical needs of those under our care, and acts to break the cycle of poverty in the Palmetto State. In God, all things are possible.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Informed and inspired through the mission of the Church, Catholic Charities of South Carolina promotes dignity, ministers to the spiritual and physical needs of those under our care, and acts to break the cycle of poverty in the Palmetto State. In God, all things are possible.
IRS990.Desc: CATHOLIC CHARITIES PROVIDES DIRECT SERVICES THROUGH VARIOUS PROGRAMS. OUR WELLNESS PANTRIES STRIVE TO PROVIDE HEALTHY FOODS ALONG WITH BEHAVIORAL ECONOMICS EDUCATION TO HELP MAKE A SYSTEMATIC CHANGE IN THE LIVES OF OUR CLIENTS IN SNAP BENEFITS. THE SAVE A SMILE PROGRAM PROVIDES ACCESS TO OUR HEALTH SOLUTIONS THAT INCLUDE THE ABILITY TO CARRY OUT THE BASIC PHYSICAL AND SOCIAL ORAL FUNCTIONS THAT WE NORMALLY TAKE FOR GRANTED. THE CLEAN OF HEART PROGRAM PROVIDES LAUNDRY, SHOWER AND AT-HOME ATMOSPHERE TO THE HOMELESS. THE RESTORATIVE JUSTICE PROGRAM WORKS TO RESTORE FAITH FOR THOSE WHO ARE PENITENT AS THEY SEEK A FRESH START WITH A GREATER SENSE OF SELF AWARENESS AND SELF-EFFICACY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE CARTER MAY HOME IS AN ASSISTED LIVING FACILITY THAT PROVIDES HOUSING AND SERVICES FOR ELDERLY ADULTS. A VARIETY OF SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES ARE OFFERED TO PROVIDE RESIDENTS WITH THE CARE THEY NEED WHILE ALSO ENCOURAGING THEM TO PURSUE AN ACTIVE LIFESTYLE. THESE SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MEDICATION MANAGEMENT, RESTAURANTS STYLE DINING, HOUSEKEEPING AND LAUNDRY SERVICES, HEALTHCARE COORDINATION, TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, CRAFTS, OUTINGS, EXERCISE, RELIGIOUS ACTIVITIES, GARDENING AND MORE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CATHOLIC CHARITIES IMMIGRATION SERVICES PROVIDES LEGAL SERVICES TO LOW-INCOME IMMIGRANTS IN SOUTH CAROLINA. SPECIFICALLY, WE ASSIST IMMIGRANTS IN FILING THE APPROPRIATE FORMS AND GATHERING NECESSARY SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS IN ORDER TO FILE FOR IMMIGRATION RELIEF. WE PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN THE FOLLOWING CASES: ADJUSTMENT OF STATUS, CONSULAR PROCESSING, NATURALIZATION, U AND T VISAS, VAWA CASES, TEMPORARY PROTECTED STATUS, DACA, SIJ,AND RENEWAL OF PERMANENT RESIDENCY AND WORK PERMITS. WE ALSO PROVIDE COMMUNITY EDUCATION OF RELEVANT IMMIGRATION LAW TOPICS.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: CATHOLIC CHARITIES' DISASTER SERVICES TEAM ENSURES CLIENTS RETURN TO SAFE, SANITARY AND SECURE LIVING CONDITIONS AFTER THE RAMIFICATIONS OF A NATURAL DISASTER. THROUGH CONTRACTOR AND COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, WE ASSIST CLIENTS IN THEIR JOURNEY TO RETURN TO SAFE, SANITARY AND SECURE LIVING CONDITIONS. MANY HAVE ADJUSTED THEIR LIFE FOR AT LEAST A YEAR BEFORE CONTACTING US, LIVING IN MOLDY OR UNSAFE CONDITIONS. REPAIRS INCLUDE ROOFING, SIDING, INTERIOR WORK SUCH AS DRYWALL, FLOORING, KITCHENS, BATHROOMS, DOORS & WINDOWS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: Bill-pay assistance, Immigration services, laundry and shower services, and counseling

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF SOUTH CAROLINA ("THE ORGANIZATION") GRANTS FUNDS TO OTHER 501 (C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS THAT CARRY OUT THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION, AS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE GRANT RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION IS REQUIRED TO REPORT BACK TO THE ORGANIZATION ON SPECIFICALLY HOW THE FUNDS WERE USED AND HOW SUCH USE CARRIES OUT THE MISSION OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES. CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF SOUTH CAROLINA ALSO MAKES GRANTS FOR THE BENEFIT OF NEEDY INDIVIDUALS. INDIVIDUALS APPLY FOR ASSISTANCE. THE APPLICATION IS REVIEWED AND IF ASSISTANCE IS APPROVED PAYMENTS ARE MADE TO THIRD PARTIES TO ASSIST WITH BILLS, ETC. THE PAYMENTS ARE NOT MADE DIRECTLY TO THE INDIVIDUALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d Description of other program services
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: (Expenses $ 189,976 including grants of $) CATHOLIC CHARITIES' DISASTER SERVICES TEAM ENSURES CLIENTS RETURN TO SAFE, SANITARY AND SECURE LIVING CONDITIONS AFTER THE RAMIFICATIONS OF A NATURAL DISASTER. THROUGH CONTRACTOR AND COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, WE ASSIST CLIENTS IN THEIR JOURNEY TO RETURN TO SAFE, SANITARY AND SECURE LIVING CONDITIONS. MANY HAVE ADJUSTED THEIR LIFE FOR AT LEAST A YEAR BEFORE CONTACTING US, LIVING IN MOLDY OR UNSAFE CONDITIONS. REPAIRS INCLUDE ROOFING, SIDING, INTERIOR WORK SUCH AS DRYWALL, FLOORING, KITCHENS, BATHROOMS, DOORS & WINDOWS.

THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE ITS OWN EMPLOYEES. ALL EMPLOYEES WHO PERFORM SERVICES FOR CATHOLIC CHARITIES ARE CONSIDERED EMPLOYEES OF THE DIOCESE OF CHARLESTON. THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION, GATHERING COMPARABLES, AND THE DOCUMENTATION AND APPROVAL PROCESS IS HANDLED BY THE HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT OF THE DIOCESE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a Members or stockholders electing members of governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BYLAWS PROVIDE THAT THE BOARD SHALL CONSIST OF A MINIMUM OF 3 DIRECTORS. THE THREE INITIAL DIRECTORS ARE THE BISHOP OF CHARLESTON, THE VICAR GENERAL OF THE DIOCESE OF CHARLESTON, AND THE DIRECTOR OF SOCIAL MINISTRY OF THE DIOCESE OF CHARLESTON. IN THE EVENT THAT THE POSITIONS OF VICAR GENERAL OR DIRECTOR OF SOCIAL MINISTRY ARE VACANT, THE BISHOP SHALL BE ENTITLED TO APPOINT OTHER PERSONS TO SERVE IN THEIR STEAD UNTIL SUCH POSITIONS ARE FILLED OR AS OTHERWISE DETERMINED BY THE BISHOP. ADDITIONAL DIRECTORS MAY BE APPOINTED BY THE BISHOP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 8b Documentation of meetings held by committees of governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: QUESTION 8B DOES NOT APPLY TO THE ORGANIZATION AS THERE ARE NO SEPARATE COMMITTEES OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AFTER THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION, IT IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES EACH BOARD MEMBER, AS A CONDITION OF SERVICE, TO SIGN A STATEMENT CONFIRMING HE/SHE IS TO BE BOUND BY THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THE POLICY REQUIRES THE BOARD MEMBER OR KEY EMPLOYEE TO COMMUNICATE HIS/HER INTEREST IN A TRANSACTION THAY MAY RESULT IN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST PRIOR TO THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTION OF SUCH TRANSACTION. THE BOARD WILL EVALUATE THE FACTS AND VOTE BY MAJORITY WHETHER SUCH TRANSACTION SHOULD BE EXECUTED. ANY BUSINESS BETWEEN A DIRECTOR OF THE BOARD OR HIS/HER BUSINESS, FIRM,OR PROFESSION AND CATHOLIC CHARITIES SHALL BE CONDUCTED ON TERMS AND CONDITIONS NO LESS FAVORABLE TO CATHOLIC CHARITIES THAN ANY SUCH BUSINESS WOULD OR COULD HAVE BEEN CONDUCTED HAD NO DIRECTOR AUTHORIZES THE TRANSACTION OF ANY SUCH BUSINESS, THE BOARD MEMBER SHALL NOT PARTICIPATE IN ANY DELIBERATIONS ( UNLESS NECESSARY TO THE ADEQUATELY EXPLAIN THE MATTER IN QUESTION), OR BE COUNTED IN ESTABLISHING A QUORUM OR PARTICIPATE IN THE VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization makes its financial statements and governing documents available upon request.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: TO FURTHER THE FAITH AND TEACHINGS OF JESUS CHRIST IN SOUTH CAROLINA
